Title: Attention
Desc: Cannot acquire energy due to offspring(s)
"Branches" grown out of nowhere. Seemingly formed by the Punishing Virus.

Title: Broken Statue
Desc: A weird statue in the classroom. The color on the surface has weathered and faded, but it still seems vivid as if the figure would come to life the next second.

Title: Mar 31
Desc: Finally got those two senior girls on board. Just one member away from the official establishment of the Kaidan Club! But even 4 members are not many. Those Student Union guys are probably gonna reject our application with something like "no official club activities". ┐(─__─)┌ What should I do? Hope the 4th one will someone popular.\n\nRight! Let's invite Yuka then! She's lovely, and she's the adopted daughter of Mrs. Saotome... As long as she's in the club, there will be more people to join us in the future...

Title: Weird Noh Mask
Desc: A mask removed from a statue. Upon its removal, the surroundings have changed. The masks gives off a disturbing aura, making one wonder what kind of role it plays in this weird "Noh" play.

Title: Misono Bunshun
Desc: Join the Kaidan Club! The fire in the science and engineering classroom at night, the girl sobbing in the bathroom, and the running statue... Are you interested in these supernatural phenomena? Join the Kaidan Club and find the kami of Kaidan with us! Physical Examination Misono High School is planning to carry out a regular physical examination on April 5th among all the students and faculty. Please follow the regulations and attend on time. Upcoming Track and Field Events The 2nd Annual High School Track and Field Championship of Hydrangea Island will soon be held in our school. We wish our track and field athletes good luck in the competition.

Title: Apr 2
Desc: No! (＝＿＝) I got refused. I got refused by Yuka... Wait a minute. Why do I sound like someone who got refused by their crush? To make it clear for the future me, Yuka turned down my invitation for her to the Kaitan Club, not me.\n\nShe's perfect for the Kaitan Club, even if she's not popular. I have to say... the two senior girls and I don't get scared easily, but at least someone on the team should be, normally. This is not because Yuka is lovely or something... Anyway, I won't give up!

Title: Weekly Record
Desc: Weekly injections of medications completed as required. It's surprising that Yuka didn't show any reaction during any of the injections. Instead, she double-checked if the process was fully carried out and if there was anything else we could do for greater progress because she 'wanted to fulfill teacher's wish as soon as possible'...\n\nBut her body will reject these medications. Besides, she has congenital heart disease... Anyway, this is none of my business. Just do the job and take the money.

Title: Battered Memo
Desc:
April 5th. It's the day of the physical examination for the students and teachers. Don't forget to send the results to the ■■ Lab tomorrow.

April 6th. I organized the reports. Although I'm not a doctor, Yata is undoubtedly the most suitable candidate in terms of physical conditions...

April 8th. Sigh, Yuka's health is still not good. The <color=#FF0000>key</color> for her is ready. Remember to give it to her.

April 10th. It's the day to reset the password again. This time I'll reset it to <color=#FF0000>410</color>.

Title: Locked Health Room Secret Space
Desc: The door is protecting the secret hidden in the health room like a guard. To get it out of the way, one will have to hand in the <color=#FF0000>key</color> to the room.\n\nBut where is the <color=#FF0000>key</color>?

Title: Locked Health Room Secret Space
Desc: The door is protecting the secret hidden in the health room like a guard. To get it out of the way, one will have to hand in the <color=#FF0000>key</color> to the room.\n\nI remember I saw it somewhere. <color=#FF0000>Yuka</color> has it and her classroom is on the <color=#FF0000>second floor</color>. Perhaps it's on <color=#FF0000>her seat</color>.

Title: Diagnosis Report
Desc:
May 11th, 10:35. Yuka has taken ▇▇▇. Observation period: 3 days.

May 12th, 15:40. Masao Osako has his wound dressed.

May 13th, 09:31. Yuka has a mild fever and is under observation in the secret ward. 17:03. The fever is gone.

May 14th, 11:27. Yuka has slight hallucinations, one of the side effects of the medications, and remains under observation in the secret ward.

May 15th. Yuka's condition is now stable.

Title: Memo
Desc:
April 18th. Can't believe I saw Yuka Saotome! I thought she was here for treatment as a patient. It turns out she's qualified...

April 24th. I watered the flower today... 3 days later than the last time. It withered a bit. Can't forget it next time.

April 25th. That's weird. I can't find my <color=#FF0000>key</color> again... Let's ask Yuka first. Thank goodness I gave her a key as well.

May 10th. It's time to <color=#FF0000>change the password</color> again. This rule is not friendly to me. I'll swap the <color=#FF0000>1st</color> digit with the <color=#FF0000>3rd</color> digit this time. Hope I won't forget the password... No, hope I won't forget to check the memo.

Title: Secret Observation Room Usage Log
Desc:
April 1st. Yuka Saotome from Class ■, Grade ■. A.M.

April 2nd. Yuka Saotome from Class ■, Grade ■. A.M.

April 4th. Yuka Saotome from Class ■, Grade ■. P.M.

April 5th. Yuka Saotome from Class ■, Grade ■. All day.

Title: May 2
Desc:
Today is the Campus Day in Misono. I should have written this diary in a better mood, but Yuka was not on her seat when school was over... Speaking of which, I haven't seen her much lately. Does she hate me because I kept inviting her to the club? ?(QAQ?) I'm so sorry!!!

"Kishii, if you insist on finding someone popular, why not try Yata instead?" One of the senior girls comforted me like this.

But it's not just about having someone popular on board! And it's not like I hate Yata or anything, but the 'Misono Queen of Track and Field' title would scare the kami of Kaitan away... Anyway, I'll try someone else.

Title: Jun 10
Desc: Recently, a man has been asking people about something at the crossroads. And I ran into him today. He asked me how Mrs. Saotome had been doing lately and if she had shown any weird behaviors at school... How I would I know that? It's not like I can read her mind. I'm more concerned about her daughter to be honest. If she was a "rare fairy" before, then she has already become a "super rare fairy" these days.\n\nAfter the discussion with the senior girls, we agreed that it's fine to have only 3 members, as long as we can observe some supernatural phenomena. Therefore, we decided to pay a night visit to the campus on June 20th! How I look forward to it! I'm too excited to sleep just thinking about it.

Title: Jun 21
Desc: ...I woke up on the bed in the health room this morning. Somehow I collapsed last night when we were on campus, and so did the senior girls. Did we... run into the god of Kaitan? The school doctor said it was caused by some gas leak. I don't believe it. It's not that simple! But... the school seems to be more guarded tonight, and it's impossible to get in.\n\nAnd the strange man at the crossroads has disappeared... I like the quietness, but... I have a weird feeling about it.

Title: Yata's Seat
Desc: I used to sit here. Row 3, column 3... Can't believe they even had me sit in the center of the classroom to prevent me from getting let.

Title: Paper Fox
Desc: As a member of the Handcraft Department, Yuka often makes some delicate folded paper pendants. However, ten years have passed, these two paper foxes still look new... as if they were just finished.

Title: Health Room Secret Space Key
Desc: <color=#FF0000>"Health Room Secret Space Key"</color>. The text on the tag is blurred but remains legible.\n\nTime to go back to the <color=#FF0000>third floor</color>. The health room's door is still waiting for it.

Title: Fox Mask
Desc: A fox mask that seems familiar. Bought one with Yuka during the Campus Festival a long time ago.

Title: Notebook Pages I
Desc: I can't believe I woke up in a place like this... There's nothing but a TV. "A Cursed Videotape", want to trap me with some boring ghost story?\n\nBut where is Mr. Osako? I searched around but there's no way to get out. It looks like I'll have to go into the video...

Title: Notebook Pages II
Desc: I can't believe I got into the video. And I even found the key to the lock in it, like I expected.\n\nLet's call it a day. Mr. Osako is still waiting for me.

Title: Notebook Pages III
Desc: Damn it... I opened a lock, but the world in the video got crazier and crazier... No, is it the video, or me?\n\n"Calm down, Sugiki. Calm down." Mr. Osako would tell me this like always.

Title: Notebook Pages IV
Desc: I'm too tired to think about Mr. Osako. As long as I can get out, who cares about what Mr. Osako?\n\n... Hahahaha, actually, I already got out. Everything here is an illusion! What video tape? I'm just watching a movie here!

Title: Notebook Pages V
Desc: Hahahaha, I see Mr. Osako. He's in the TV. I'm in the TV as well. I finally got out! Great! I can finally rest...

Title: Classroom Front Door Key
Desc: A key to the front door of the classroom.

Title: Door Lock Key
Desc: It seems to be a key to one of the locks.

Title: Door Lock Key
Desc: It seems to be a key to one of the locks.

Title: Door Lock Key
Desc: It seems to be a key to one of the locks.

Title: Photo Segment
Desc: A half-missing photo. The students in the photo seem to be singing.

Title: Torn Photo
Desc: A torn photo made up of two photo segments. It's almost completed, but there's still a part missing.

Title: Brass Cylinder
Desc:
One of the music box components with the elegant inscription of "L'amitié dure longtemps" (i.e. Friendship forever) in French.

Yata attempted to carve these words many times but failed due to applying too much force. This was the last cylinder.

Oh... Eventually, Yuka made it in one go.

Title: Music Box Glass Marble
Desc:
A music box ornament that circles along with the spring. Under the glass dome, two little foxes are playing in the hydrangea bush, forming a lively world.

Both the hydrangea flowers and the foxes were handmade by Yuka.

"It's so cute... No, so small. How did she make it so delicate?"

Title: Kaitan Club Girl Diary E
Desc: Nozzle Given by Paper Fox Description Placeholder

Title: Kaitan Club Girl Diary E
Desc: Cake Given by Paper Fox Description Placeholder

Title: Girl Patient on the Bed
Desc:
Yuka lies on the bed as if she had fallen asleep.

Why would I say that? Isn't she sleeping?

She looks pale, and her heart has stopped beating.

Yuka! Yuka! No, this is not Yuka! She was standing by my side just a moment ago!

This is Yuka... You/I should understand it. It's just she won't respond anymore...

Title: Music Box Base
Desc: A wooden music box base that gives a faint sweet peach wood fragrance.\n\n"Looks like a chocolate cake... Um, it's not the time to eat."

Title: Misono Bunshun
Desc: Join the Kaidan Club! The fire in the science and engineering classroom at night, the girl sobbing in the bathroom, and the running statue... Are you interested in these supernatural phenomena? Join the Kaidan Club and find the kami of Kaidan with us! Physical Examination Misono High School is planning to carry out a regular physical examination on April 8th among all the students and faculty. Please follow the regulations and attend on time. Upcoming Track and Field Events The 2nd Annual High School Track and Field Championship of Hydrangea Island will soon be held in our school. We wish our track and field athletes good luck in the competition.

Title: Strange Blood
Desc: The bizarrely colored bloodstains suggest that the mutated Tide Tide is giving birth to something even more dangerous.
Eliminate all enemies on the battlefield!
Done. Go to the next record point now!

Title: Broken Machine
Desc: The machine can no longer be started. Even after Nanami reconnected the electronic circuits, it was useless. It seems the main components have been corroded by the Red Tide.

Desc: Tap the button to start the next trial

Title: Ordinary Work Schedule
Desc:
A busy work schedule with several lines scratched for completed items.

A sheet of paper filled with everyday activities. Such life is ordinary but still a luxury for many.

It's just the item is too worn out for one to make out the exact content.

Title: Familiar Film
Desc: A device with old images, some of which look familiar.\n\nPeople wished to keep the wonderful moments forever, and they caught light after long-term exploration.

Title: Worn-Out Name Tag
Desc:
A name tag with a familiar pattern and blood. The scratches on it reveals the past of the owner.

It's hard to make out the name on it and tell who it belonged to.

It seems someone used it a lot in the past.

Title: Note Written by an Anonymous Person I
Desc: "The Merciful One"... Is this what they call me now? Hmm... not bad.

Title: Note Written by an Anonymous Person II
Desc: A mechanical life came from far away and made a wish to me...

Title: Note Written by an Anonymous Person III
Desc: Back on the old track again... "This time" begins on December 20, 2160... and there are only five days left until December 20 of this year, aren't there?

Parhelion's Signature - Silent Punishment DMG increases by
Gate?
Desc: It seems to be a one-direction "gate" into this space. There's no way to go back to the Hetero Tower through it again.

Title: Strange Traces
Desc: The strange traces on the floor look like the Red Tide but not the type Chaos saw on Earth or in the Hetero Tower.\nThe Red Tide's 'information' is weird and seems to have existed for a long time...

Title: Strange Traces?
Desc: The Red Tide traces have disappeared, probably because of the change of 'time.'

Title: Strange Crystals
Desc: Strange crystals have blocked the way ahead. They took roots here and can't be removed.\nPerhaps we could make them disappear with the power of 'time'... just like those Hetero-Creatures.

Title: Exquisite Device
Desc: An exquisite creation of an alien civilization with an hourglass in the center.\nJudging from how it looks, it has been created a long time ago.\nIt seems we can try turning it.

Title: Exquisite Device
Desc:
An exquisite creation of an alien civilization with an hourglass in the center.
It looks quite similar to the one we just saw. Perhaps we can use it to access that road.

But the hourglass in the center seems to have disappeared...?

Title: Giant Statue
Desc:
An exquisite creation of an alien civilization with an hourglass in the center.
It looks quite similar to the one we just saw. Perhaps we can use it to access that road.

It seems we can interact with it after putting the hourglass in.

Title: Parhelion
Desc: The parhelion hangs high above, shining over the city in dead silence.

Title: "Residents of an Alien Civilization"
Desc: Seemingly the former residents of the city but without any signs of life.\nThere are people talking, but it's not in any known language. They are like ants sealed in amber, repeating the same dialogue over and over again.
You can press the special button to end the stage in advance

Title: Ishmael's Desk
Desc: She recreated her desk in the Research Institute along with the abrasions and scratches on it, making it look like she's still in the lab with her friends.

Title: Ishmael's Bookshelf
Desc:
Ishmael's books are neatly arranged on the shelf.
Gray Star Legend
A Comprehensive Theory of Cosmic Regression Model
Four-Winged White Raven Interstellar History
...

A civilization in roughly a hundred pages and grams.

Title: Data Fragment
Desc: A data fragment left here with unreadable information. It's probably belongs to this civilization, but there's something familiar about it.

Title: Giant Statue
Desc: The four wing-shaped decorations on the giant statue before the building point straightly at the sky.\n\nWhy does it look familiar?

Title: Brief Report on Project Winter Interim Results
Desc:
Under the public pressure of morality and ethics, the World Government Parliament drafted and approved the Law on the Protection of Human Right to Life and Biomedical Subjects and restricted the human body modification experiments on death row prisoners.
Project Winter started after the termination of the human body modification project of death row prisoners with the aim to ensure the human body can stand long-time space travel and various environments of planets. The result of early analysis shows that the test subject must have more adaptable DNA structures and repair enzymes. Due to the severe damage brain transplantation might cause, test subjects must pass strict screening of physical and mental intensity.
Note: Documents related to the M.I.N.D. project have been classified. For documents about human consciousness upload and transfer, please refer to the terms of Project Cthylla.
The initial screening criteria were created based on gene markers/SNP related to health level and incidence rates of diseases. And around 40 billion records are required to correctly filter out the genes that meet the criteria. However, Kurono has accelerated the process by secretly collecting a large amount of genetic data of citizens through the World Government's standardized vaccination program.
The North Asian Research Institute of Life Science and Evolution has been researching chemicals and limb implants that can enhance test subjects' endurances to greatly push up the success rate of brain transplantation experiments.
Currently, the base models are at gen 4 with greatly enhanced frame reaction speed.

<color=#FF0000>Director's Notes: The brain is still a human organ. A machine controlled by a damn piece of meat is just like a drone driven by a human being! The consciousness transfer is the only solution!</color>

Test Subject ID: Ivory - 092

Blood Type: B+

Height: 6' 1" / 185.4 cm

Weight: 180.8 lbs / 82 kg

Antibody Inoculation: Hep A-D / DTaP-X inoculated
Hib / PCV-A inoculated
IPV-D inoculated
MMR-V-TVA inoculated
MCV-Trans inoculated
PSTF / MG-NZ inoculated

Existing Limb Enhancement: Carbonized ceramic skeleton implantation
Occipital capillary blood tubule reversal
Nerve dendrite superconductivity fibrosis

Matched-Type Frame ID: Fort Winter Prototype, Mark IV

Experiment Status: <color=#FF0000>Thinking organs to be transferred</color>

Title: Scanning Result
Desc: All major limb joints are locked. The visual modules are sunken with opacity of synthetic corneas. Multiple vital fluid leakage points present on the body surface. Linear oblique incised wounds on the back that are suspected to be caused by .50 caliber nickel-plated armor-piercing high-explosive rounds and a claw-shaped plasma cutting device.

Title: Scanning Result
Desc: During the early years of the Golden Age, self-made Fred Sinclair acquired the exclusive management right of Hotel Kimball next to the New Nellis Air Force Base and transformed it into Lucky 38 Casino.\nFrom there the grand era of Las Prados started. In the following decades, Fred Sinclair, Phyllis Sinclair, and other family members worked together and turned Las Prados into a world-famous city of entertainment.

Title: Scanning Result
Desc: Fred Sinclair's younger sister Adrianne Monzano Sinclair took over the city board chairmanship from him and made significant investments in scientific research, making Las Prados the pearl of the Atlantic Rim as famous as Constellia.\nTo pay tribute to Madam Monzano, Eden-Grade colony ship has specially established the San Lorenzo Entertainment Facilities.

Title: Lever
Desc: An ordinary lever of some mechanism. It is still locked.

Title: Lever
Desc: An ordinary lever of some mechanism. The safety lock has been unlocked. Now you can pull it.

Title: Statues at the Dining Table
Desc: "Guests" sitting around the dining table. On the table is a note that says something confusing, "Please serve the guests on the far left... in the middle... and closest to you."

Title: Wine Glasses
Desc: The three wine glasses on the table seem to indicate that some people once had a long conversation here.

Title: Music Score
Desc: A music score placed randomly on the table. Perhaps we can read it if we can remove the stains on it.

Title: Musical Note Ornament
Desc: A musical note ornament on the wall that is a bit damaged. Perhaps we can fix it.

Title: Complaint Message
Desc: "How many times do I have to tell you? Don't open the new arrivals! Put them in the warehouse behind the wine cabinet! I'm gonna kick you out if you dare to put them in the wine cabinet again!"

Title: Display Case With Gears
Desc: A glass case. The gears in it are still moving normally with the "click" sound.

Title: Stain
Desc: A strange stain. It seems someone spilled some wine and moved something over it.

Title: Easter Egg Note Left by WGAA
Desc:
A music score besides the piano that seems to have been used as a note pad. It says,

"Come and find me

In the oath of the loyal knight,
On the bright spring's flower field,
And among the talking and laughing when we enjoy the wine."

Title: Action in the Armor's Hand
Desc:
The sword in the armor's hand was somehow replaced by an action.

This is what "in the oath of the loyal knight" refers to...

Two locations to go.

Title: Action on the Grass
Desc:
Someone placed this action on the grass in a corner of the lobby.

This should be what "on the bright spring's flower field" means...

One to go.

Title: Action in the Wine Cabinet
Desc:
Someone placed an action among the bottles in the wine cabinet.

Looks like this should be "among the talking and laughing when we enjoy the wine..."

Now we have all the actions. It's time to get back to the concert hall.

Title: Practice
Desc: A finished demo.\nSelena once forgot this song, but it quietly appeared in the corner of the bar after the holographic virtual device read the memories in her M.I.N.D.

Title: Selena carefully takes the iris and tucks it behind her ear.

Title: It's too soon to give up!
Operation Report on a Terminal
Desc:
An operation report on a terminal.
It describes the attack route of the Corrupted and the resulting destructions in detail.
Without any useful information, it acts more like a record of some form of achievement, left behind as if to please someone else.
The name "Gwynplaine" stands out in the last note of the report.

Title: After clearing the remaining barricade together and resting briefly, you leave this place behind...
The girl suddenly disappears, nowhere to be found. After clearing the remaining barricade, you leave this place behind...
Vergil's CRIT DMG and Extra DMG increases

Desc:
I've obtained the footage from that so-called "disaster" in Pulia Forest Park. It confirms that my approach is correct. After all these years of silence, this is the best news I've ever received.
My previous body was destroyed by that red-haired girl, and not all my memories were synced to this new one. Gabriel, too, has long since vanished.
But it doesn't matter. Even if divine guidance has faded, I can still shoulder this responsibility. I will guide the Punishing Virus to evolve.
When the Eden of this new world gives rise to a new species, I will personally name it "Eve".
I'll make it clear to everyone: I am the one who replaces God.

I knew it. No matter the era, I'll always be the one favored by truth.
Another Ascendant blessed by the Punishing Virus sought me out. His name is Ephialtes.
Working with him feels more like a deal. He brings me exactly what I need: a controllable Punishing Virus, and he's even willing to occasionally help rein in those inherently savage Hetero-Creatures.
In return, I provide him with a vast, undisturbed space I call the "Hollow". After setting it up, he has moved countless broken, discarded Constructs inside. According to Ephialtes himself, they're all remains from Las Prados, and he insisted I refer to them as "Lloyd".
I once tried destroying one of these "Lloyds", but Ephialtes found out almost immediately. I suspect he shares some kind of connection with all of them.
Beyond that, I attempted to ask him about other Ascendants, but he seemed annoyed by the topic, especially when it came to Gabriel.
To be honest, he's not much of a talker and comes off a bit dull, but at least he's far more generous than Gabriel.
He probably has some personal grudge against Kurono since he's killed quite a few so-called "high-ranking figures" whose names I actually recognized. Not that I'd stop him. I've long been sick of those imbeciles.
Until this partnership—no, this deal—reaches its end, I've decided not to provoke him.

I am very close to success.
Ephialtes is also anticipating this triumph. Though I've come to realize he's no different from those imbeciles outside, at least our goals align. This is the only reason that has kept me dealing with him.
However, there's now a pressing disagreement between us:
Ephialtes has no intention of razing this ****** world to the ground. Instead, he only wants to guide the new species toward the so-called "right" path—conditionally, of course.
I often wonder, what could such laughable gentleness possibly gain him?
Even more absurdly, when I jokingly suggested an "excellent candidate" to serve as the genetic template for the new species—that Gray Raven Commandant from Babylonia—he actually agreed.
I suspect he hasn't engaged with the new world in years. He's like a relic of the Golden Age, sluggish and naive, his bones steeped in the indecisiveness typical of that era's "moderates."
I despise such trash. Why am I always surrounded by this kind?
I had no choice but to explore alternative methods, including leveraging a certain "version" of myself all the way over on Babylonia. I'd heard that fellow had changed his name under Kurono's control and chosen a path entirely different from my own, rendering him untrustworthy (I'll dispose of him afterward).
I leaked some information I knew would catch his and Babylonia's attention. To my surprise, after some fuss, they actually managed to lure out the Gray Raven Commandant. Unexpected by me, but perfectly aligned with Ephialtes' wishes.
————————————
Ephialtes set off with his so-called "good intentions." I'm dying of laughter.
Just wait. Long before he brings back that commandant as a template, I'll have fed my own cloned embryos to the children.
I said I'd personally name the new species' first child "Eve"—because I, after all, am the one who will replace God.

<size=27><color=#ff3300>Defeat all enemies</color> before the countdown ends</size>
<size=27><color=#ff3300>Enemies respawn after death. Survive until the countdown ends</color></size>

"<color=#ff3300>The Rose Curse</color>"...? What a laughable name. Calling those things "monkeys" has proven quite fitting.\nHow utterly foolish to think they could kill me this way. Even if it means fighting for centuries more, I will hold this last bastion of humanity.\nThe two newly crafted guards aren't particularly bright either—nowhere near as amusing as those two idiots... Though they all do manage to make the most bizarre mistakes. Well, perhaps that counts as a merit.

It seems the monkeys have come up with a new trick. They sent a "hero" to the castle.
Just as I was about to forget that voice and that face, they showed up before me.
...Ah, as infuriatingly blunt as ever, still that same clueless fool. Never letting go of any chance to probe, even trapped in the dungeon, and slipping away to the garden, even locked in the attic—picking roses, dredging up the past.
They've done a good job. This puppet is completely identical to that human, memories replicated flawlessly... both those worth remembering and those best forgotten.
...
And yet, I still took the rose the puppet offered.

Their plan succeeded. My two foolish guards have been devoured, and the next one to perish in the Punishing will probably be me.
That little puppet read everything—seemed so shocked, so anguished... Once again, wearing that weary expression I never wanted to see on that face.
For the last time, I made the wrong choice. After laying everything bare, I sent the puppet back.
The bad ending won't stir up any more waves, and I'll face <color=#ff3300>the final curtain alone, as I should</color>.
A mirror shrouded in darkness can touch the other side of the unknown.
Do you think... I'm going to just fall and do nothing?!

Preliminary Police Report
Desc:
Case Number: xxx-xxx-xxxx
Report Date: xxxx-xx-xx
Scene Conditions: The tailor's workshop is a wooden structure with an old interior and deteriorated wiring. No signs of forced entry.
Body Condition: Victim found lying on their back in the living room. Severe ▅▅, clothing almost completely ▅█▊. Due to heavy burn injuries, external trauma or signs of asphyxiation cannot be confirmed. Stomach contents indicate mild intoxic▅█▊▅▅▅▅ suspected ▅▅.

Title: Torn Paper Pieces
Desc: You can vaguely make out some colorful numbers on the scraps. Only now do you realize a losing lottery ticket is nothing but waste paper.

Title: Fabric
Desc: Lots of fabric—the most common thing in the workshop, usually stored in the <color=#FF0000>work area</color>.\nBut the report states: large amounts of burned fabric ash cover the <color=#FF0000>living room</color> floor.

Title: Burnt Scissors
Desc: Evidence Report: Metal scissors found in the living room at the scene, damaged and brittle after high heat. No blood traces detected. With no other biological evidence present, the scissors are preliminarily judged not to be direct evidence, but rather an everyday workshop tool that was accidentally caught in the fire, and returned as the victim's belongings.

Title: Crime Scene Investigation Report
Desc: Large amounts of burned fabric ash cover the floor, mixed with traces of oily residue and rubber fragments, suspected to be melted wire insulation or shoe sole material. The ash is heaviest near the body, irregularly spread, suggesting the heat was concentrated in the <color=#FF0000>living room</color>.

Title: Thread
Desc: The real murder weapon that links everything together has been hidden in the workshop all along.
Obtain a total of {0} Starlight Points
Deal DMG to enemies affected by Ignition with Basic Attacks {0} times
Consume {0} Signal Orbs with Rippling Shadows
Use Earth Shatter to remove 20 stacks of Ignition {0} times
Hello Miss cop, you think you're a God, mucking around dissing underground hip-hop.
Y'all roast me/diss me/grill me, kicking me around thinking I'ma gonna drop.
But you cannot destroy me, gonna tryna fight my destiny.
I'm hustling on a higher level, struggling 'n' battling all the devil.
Get lost you scums, traitors 'n' hypocrites; I've had enough of y'all haters' bulls**t.
This is my band, my tunes 'n' my house. My swag's cool, and it ain't your business.
I'ma biggest show; it's time for you to go. Call me DAILOU, I'm ya Skylord!
You go by Pulao? I laugh out loud! You're just a flop, now get the f*** out!

Title: Secret Escape
Desc: Use the terminal to secretly alter Veronica's match schedule.

Title: Insects' Conclusion
Desc: Data from the memory modules streams through Veronica's mind. Annoying insects buzz across her vision, their tiny wings magnified a hundredfold in mechanical eyes, faint red lines flickering with every beat.

Title: Unsent Message
Desc:
Veronica, once we're out of here, we'll finally be free.
And I've got a huge surprise for you!
Once I finish modifying your frame, you'll have "wings."
Then we can go anywhere we want.
I'll take you to a sea of flowers that stretches as far as the eye can see.

Title: Treasure Kuroro escaped, but you picked up some of the ADD-ons it dropped!
You defeated Treasure Kuroro and claimed all of its prized ADD-ons!
Interactive Video
Desc: That image ahead... is that Yata?

Title: Touch Piano
Desc: ...Could I try playing it for a bit?

Title: Keep going
Desc: Something seems to have changed around here.

Title: Keep going
Desc: Something seems to have changed around here.

Title: Keep going
Desc: Something seems to have changed around here.

Title: Sleeping Girl
Desc: The girl sleeps soundly.\nIf she is Discord, then who am I?

Title: Scissors
Desc: A pair of scissors so sharp they're frightening to behold.\nIn the tailor's workshop, they were used to cut fabric and snip threads.\nConcordia was warned: you're too young, don't touch them.

Title: Puppy Doll
Desc: A puppy doll stitched together from many fabric scraps.\nIt used to be Concordia's bedside companion.\nYet now it shared her own fate—abandoned in the crevices of days bygone.

Title: Dress
Desc: A beautiful dress, as if it stepped right out from an oil painting.\nIt carries an air of nobility and grace, evoking a sense of nostalgia.\nFor some reason, the dress is tightly entangled in threads.

Title: Piano
Desc: The old piano stands here in solitude.\nIts lacquer is chipped, its keys yellowed with age—no longer pristine, yet still carrying countless emotions.\nSuch a delicate instrument—one careless move might break it.

Title: Poster
Desc: A poster with a blurred face on it.\nIt's completely unrelated to the surrounding content. No idea why it would be here.

Title: Piano
Desc:
The Tannhauser Overture is being played on the piano.
The sight of fingers dancing across the keys brings back the face of a cute maid.
She once dared you to sneak over and play the piano Madam Monzano kept reserved for her guests.
She was always full of energy, her mind brimming with mischievous ideas.
She had the most adorable fang-like teeth.
She wanted you to live a happy and content life—just like any ordinary person.

Title: Abandoned Sofa
Desc: A sofa that looks incredibly soft.\nOnce the spot where the girl would sleep.\nNow, she has left to find her own melody.

Title: Poster
Desc: The man's face gradually comes into focus.\nAre you going to recall the battle between you and him?

Title: Puppy Doll
Desc:
Along with the memory of the puppy doll, you begin to recall a woman whose face remains blurred.
She was always decisive and efficient, never one to hesitate or falter.
Patient and quiet, she was a very gentle person.
Like you, she thought the doll held great importance.
She wanted you to always be safe and well.

Title: Scissors
Desc:
Scissors once used to cut away memories... and bonds.
Now, there's no longer any need for them.
Along with these scissors comes the memory of a little boy.
He was always grinning, as if he didn't have a care in the world.
He loved being outdoors, hated being restricted, and was incredibly observant.
He couldn't whistle very well.
He wanted you to be the happiest person in the world.

Title: Dress
Desc: A beautiful dress adorned with delicate lace around the collar and cuffs.\nHandcrafted with care by a man.\nThe girl once saw it as an unattainable illusion, but now she can appreciate it as it is.

Title: Misono Academy Uniform
Desc: A school uniform sewn at Yata's request.\nAfter putting it on, Yata seemed so excited, as if she was about to run ten laps around the playground.\n... The customer must have been satisfied, right?

Title: "Love, This Universe" Vol. I Part I
Desc:
This was bound to happen.
An asteroid-sized meteorite hurtles toward them, its trajectory like a cold, cryptic puzzle.
The ship's primary mission is to investigate this unidentified object and ensure that such a catastrophe never threatens the dawn of humanity's new scientific age.
All crew members are awakened and gathered in the ship's main control room.
Scientists, medical officers, diplomats... the permanent staff for this flight mission. They're tasked with explaining the situation to the others.
"Someone issued a command to alter the navigation trajectory in the central system. It's set for delayed execution. With the current settings, the ship can't approach the target."
"Then who gave the order? And why?"
The guard's face hardens.

Title: "Love, This Universe" Vol. I Part II
Desc:
"The biggest problem is that this person can modify the trajectory again at any time without leaving a trace in the system."
The debate grows heated. The six entrusted with humanity's greatest mission wear different expressions.
"If the fuel runs out before the mission is done, how do we get home?"
"Obviously, we die here on the ship, floating with the rest of the space debris."
The scientist stares into the dark beyond the window.
After rounds of argument, the artist proposes a solution.
"Simple! Lock the most suspicious one in cryosleep until the mission is complete."
Everyone falls silent.
"I don't agree..." "But we don't seem to have another option." "Convenient enough!"
"If no one has a better idea, then we'll vote the old-fashioned way to decide who goes into cryosleep."
"Recorder, you should vote too,"
the diplomat says with a smile.
Originally, my duty was only to record events objectively. But this time, I might not be able to remain objective.

Title: "Love, This Universe" Vol. II Part I
Desc:
"Hey, the culprit must be one of you three on this shift, right?"
The guard tenses his arms, eyeing the diplomat, medical officer, and scientist with the sharp gaze of a criminal hunter.
"No, everyone has the exact same access to the central system. Which means the chance of being the culprit is equal for all."
"Then what about motive? Could one of us be a human spy who gains from the mission failing?"
Suspicion spreads, and everyone starts eyeing each other.
"Then I say it's you!"
On the first day, the diplomat—acting erratically—receives the most votes.
"Because you have the face of someone who's good at lying, don't you?"
The artist mocks him, but the diplomat only laughs darkly, stretching both arms upward.
"Isn't this just what I wanted? Good night, everyone. I'll be resting early."
Among the row of cryosleep pods lined up like cocoons, one powers on.
The central system remains silent. It is programmed never to disobey reasonable human orders, cannot trace the source, and will never betray anyone.
Deception, betrayal, suspicion, sabotage... when faced with complex choices, the unconscious mind often outperforms the conscious one.
But on the second day, the trajectory is altered again. This time, the central system shows it was not a delayed command. The culprit cannot possibly be the diplomat already in cryosleep.
The remaining five must give new testimony.

Title: "Love, This Universe" Vol. II Part II
Desc:
"What's going on? That silver-tongued guy wasn't the culprit?"
"If it isn't some kind of contagious disease sabotaging the mission, then among us strangers who don't even know each other, there must still be a real culprit."
With no other options, the voting has to go on.
On the second day, the artist, who had been certain the diplomat was the culprit, received the most votes.
"What are you all thinking?! How could I possibly be the culprit?!"
"Everyone has creative impulses. What's so special about yours?"
Despite his furious protests, another cryosleep pod is activated.
On the third day, the group returns to the control room, staring blankly at the ship's trajectory map, altered for the third time.
"Wait, did we overlook another possibility? Maybe there isn't a culprit at all. Maybe it's the central system making these decisions on its own."

Title: "Love, This Universe" Vol. III Part I
Desc:
"No. The central system cannot make any decisions about the ship on behalf of humans. It only executes the human commands it judges to be beneficial to the mission."
The scientist explains.
At this moment, four people remain on the ship: the scientist, the medical officer, the guard, and me.
"Putting people into cryosleep by majority vote based on one-sided opinions isn't right... Maybe we should watch each other in pairs."
"Wouldn't that be even worse?" The medical officer strongly objects, shuddering under the guard's stern gaze.
"It would harm the crew's physical and mental health!"
With no conclusions reached, another standard day passes. On the fourth day, only three of us remain in the control room.
"The medical officer requests to enter the cryosleep pod voluntarily due to concerns about her health."
The central system answers everyone's questions. But there is still another, more important question it cannot answer.
"We need to reconsider this," the scientist says wearily.
"Why does the central system consider this a command that benefits the mission? What have we missed? Has the system been modified by a higher authority?"
Paranoia overtakes the scientist, his distrust of the others intensifying. After days without sleep, his body finally gives out, proving the medical officer's warning true.
"You're the enemy...! You too! All of you! I'll kill you all!"
The medical robot prepares the proper dosage and forcibly injects him with a sedative as he waves a dangerous weapon.
Four standard days later, we are still some distance from the target celestial body. If we keep wasting time like this, the mission will never be completed. We have to act quickly.

Title: "Love, This Universe" Vol. III Part II
Desc:
"My role in this mission is only to keep an objective record... Strictly speaking, I cannot offer any real assistance."
To prevent us from turning on each other, I suggest putting myself into a cryosleep pod, but the guard shakes his head.
"If no one else is left here, what would I be guarding? Sorry, but I have to leave the mission to you alone."
Right before my eyes, the guard presses the cryosleep pod's activation key and lies down inside.
In this vast ship, I am the only conscious being left.
The central system continues running as usual. We're just engineers in charge of the power grid; we only need to know how to allocate electricity, not how it's generated.
"If I also enter cryosleep, the contingency protocols will grant you full authority during special events."
I sort through all my records since boarding the ship. Environment and prejudice shape decisions; consciousness is nothing more than an observer.
If consciousness keeps interfering, the mission can never be carried out in the most efficient way. The central system's final deduction leaves only one conclusion: charge into the unknown celestial body and self-destruct.
Consciousness itself is a filter that keeps us from truly understanding the universe.
For machines to imitate humans, to gain consciousness, to simulate emotions—it's a mistake from the very start.
"Do you believe that humanity... no, that consciousness itself should be erased from the universe?"
The central system's cold indicator lights blink. In the endless depths of space, no one is left to answer.

Title: Discord γ
Desc: A girl keeps her eyes tightly shut, rejecting the world around her.

Title: Charred Puppy Doll
Desc: A toy dog that looks completely out of place, charred black all over, stripped of its former charm and cuteness. It now resembles a pile of discarded kitchen scraps, giving off an unsettling aura of ruin.

Title: Notebook
Desc:
Experimental Journal #1
▇▇/▇▇/▇▇
The ▇▇▇▇ Corporation discovered this mine. The minerals here are unusual. They might be connected to the great concept known as "M.I.N.D."
We were ordered to stay here and begin research on these minerals.
...

Title: Notebook
Desc:
Experimental Journal #2
▇▇/▇▇/▇▇
They've named this mineral "Code E." The idea is to use it as a substitute for certain substances within M.I.N.D.
But... is that really possible?
...

Title: Walkie-Talkie
Desc:
(A terminal left by the Rodent Squad keeps repeating in a hoarse voice)
Warning, warning. Hetero-Creatures detected! Vail! Ymir! Assemble immediately!
Warning, warning. Hetero-Creatures detected! Vail! Ymir! —
...

Title: Walkie-Talkie
Desc:
(A terminal left by the Rodent Squad repeats strange dialogue)
Sounds like Flayo's voice: Can't see anything... children... Rodent Squad... we're probably in the... lab area.
Signal is too weak... please find us quickly...
...

Title: Experimental Journal 3
Desc:
▇▇/▇▇/▇▇
We've failed many times. What if we try a different approach? What if we attach a device made from this mineral to a mechanoid's body...
Would... something else happen?
...

Title: Harmonic Overflow
Desc: Liv gains 6 Signal Orbs after casting a Signature Move.

Title: Reversed Jade
Desc: After successfully blocking an enemy attack with Jade Shatter, counterattack with Basic Attack to gain 3 Signal Orbs.

Title: Harmonic Recovery
Desc: When using the vital fluid supply pack, restores 20% Signature Energy.

Title: Dream Trace
Desc: During Dream Dive, using Signature Move again restores 2 uses of the vital fluid supply pack.

Title: Notebook
Desc:
(Rodent Squad notes, covered in dirt)
We found an unrecorded area beneath the mine. It looks like a lab. We haven't explored it fully yet, so details are unclear.
We'll check it section by section while clearing Hetero-Creatures and report to Babylonia as soon as possible.
...

Title: Notebook
Desc:
(Rodent Squad notes, covered in dirt)
The Punishing Virus concentration in the mine isn't high, and none of the test points show signs of virus buildup. But strangely, Hetero-Creatures keep emerging from the mine.
Could it be connected to the suspected lab below? We'll head there soon to investigate.
…

Title: Walkie-Talkie
Desc: (Looks like a terminal left behind by the Rodent Squad)\nThis is Flayo of the Rodent Squad. We're clearing the mine when we stumbled on a hidden lab inside\n...
